channel.title: Depression & Optimism – Seven Countries Study
channel.description: Since 1947. The first major study to look at dietary components and patterns and lifestyle as risk factors for cardiovascular disease, over multiple countries and extended periods of time.

item.title: Optimism and cardiovascular disease
item.dc:creator: SCS
item.description: High optimism low CVD mortality Optimism was a relatively stable trait over 15 years in the Zutphen Elderly Study. Elderly men with a high level of optimism had only half the risk of 15-year CVD mortality compared to those with a low level of optimism. Similar results were obtained after adjustment for CVD risk [...]

item.title: Depressive symptoms and cardiovascular disease
item.dc:creator: SCS
item.description: Depressive symptoms related to CVD mortality Elderly men from the FINE study cohorts of Finland, the Netherlands and Italy who manifested a number of depressive symptoms had a 2-fold greater 10-year CVD mortality. The relative risk did not change after excluding cases that died from CVD in the first 5 years of follow-up. The [...]

item.title: Lung function, cognitive function, depressive symptoms and suicide
item.dc:creator: SCS
item.description: Poor lung function is a risk factor of cognitive impairment, depression and suicide In the European cohorts of the Seven Countries Study poor lung function in middle age was related to a higher risk of cognitive impairment, depressive symptoms and completed suicide in late life. An interaction was observed for APOE4 genotypes. Lung function [...]

item.title: Self-rated health, disability, depression and all-cause mortality
item.dc:creator: SCS
item.description: In the FINE study levels of self-rated health, disability and depressive symptoms were assessed in elderly men.

item.title: Disability and depressive symptoms
item.dc:creator: SCS
item.description: In elderly men from Finland, Italy and the Nethelands in the FINE Study, self-reported information on disability and depressive symptoms was collected in 1990 and 1995.

item.title: Lifestyle, diet and optimism
item.dc:creator: SCS
item.description: A healthy diet, especially eating more fruit, vegetables, and whole grain bread was related to a higher level of optimism.

item.title: Optimism and depressive symptoms
item.dc:creator: SCS
item.description: The results suggest that optimistic elderly men are at a lower risk to develop depressive symptoms.

item.title: Nutrient intake and depressive symptoms
item.dc:creator: SCS
item.description: The results suggest that in contrast to the intake of B-vitamins, a high intake of the fish fatty acids EPA-DHA was associated with a low risk of depressive symptoms.

item.title: Depressive symptoms, physical inactivity and cardiovascular disease
item.dc:creator: SCS
item.description: Physical inactivity may be the intermediate factor in the relation between depressive symptoms and cardiovascular disease.

item.title: Lifestyle factors and depressive symptoms
item.dc:creator: SCS
item.description: In elderly men, mild physical activity and moderate alcohol intake may lower the risk of depressive symptoms.
